Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chromosome \Chro"mo*some`\, n. [Gr. ? color + ? the body.] (Biol.) One of the minute bodies into which the chromatin of the nucleus is resolved during mitotic cell division; the {idant} of Weismann. [1913 Webster]
chromosome n : a threadlike body in the cell nucleus that carries the genes in a linear order
